intro: Zeugandra iranshahrii, commonly known as the Iranian zeugandra, is a flowering plant native to the forests of Iran. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and showy bracts. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
